properties.areaDesc: Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills; Sierra Madre Range; South Laramie Range; Snowy Range
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 1 at 2:01PM MST until February 4 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY FOR EAST CENTRAL THROUGH SOUTH CENTRAL WYOMING...

* WHAT...Snow and freezing drizzle possible. Snow may be heavy at
times Sunday night into Monday. Total snow accumulations of 4 to
8 inches possible in the lower elevations including plains, with
8 to 16 inches in the mountains. Winds could gust as high as 40
mph.

* WHERE...Snowy...Sierra Madre and south Laramie Ranges. Goshen
County in southeast Wyoming.

* WHEN...From late Sunday night through late Monday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions
could impact the morning and evening commutes.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT
